title: Fact-Checking Fundamentals
description: Discover tools and strategies for verifying the credibility of news and media sources, ensuring the accuracy of shared information.

topics.description: Overview of the importance of fact-checking in modern journalism and everyday information consumption. This module sets the stage for understanding how misinformation spreads and why fact-checking is critical in the digital age.

Learn how to recognize credible versus unreliable sources of information. This topic covers journalistic standards, source verification techniques, and how to assess the legitimacy of different types of media.

Explore the differences between misinformation (false information spread without intent to deceive) and disinformation (false information spread with malicious intent), and understand how both impact public perception.

Discover digital tools, plugins, and resources available for verifying facts, images, and videos. You will learn to use tools like reverse image search, fact-checking databases, and browser extensions to ensure information accuracy.
This module covers techniques to verify the authenticity of visual media. Learn how to identify digitally manipulated images or deepfakes, and how to use reverse image search tools for verification.

Dive into the ethical considerations surrounding fact-checking. Explore the responsibility of journalists, researchers, and individuals in maintaining information integrity and avoiding biases in the verification process.

Learn how to apply the fact-checking strategies you've acquired to everyday situations. Whether you are sharing news on social media or researching a topic, these practices will ensure your information is reliable.
